common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Issues and Launch Failures
common_issues.description: Users reported slow startup times, inability to launch PiecesOS, or getting stuck during the boot process. This issue was observed across macOS and Windows platforms. The Pieces team released updates (v11.1.2, desktop app patch 3.3.8) to address these issues. Users are recommended to update to the latest version and follow troubleshooting steps provided by the Pieces team if the problem persists.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: PiecesOS startup issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Multiple users reported issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to start completely.**
* **These issues were observed on both Windows and macOS.**
* **The root cause of the problem varied depending on the user's environment.**
* **Possible causes included:**
    * **Outdated version of PiecesOS**
    * **Conflicting software like OneDrive**
    * **Underlying hardware limitations (older processor)**
    * **Issues with the app installer**
    * **Software glitches in the desktop app**
* **The Pieces team actively monitored the issue and provided troubleshooting steps and updates.**
* **A series of updates were released to address the reported issues.**
* **The majority of users reported successful resolution after updating to the latest version (11.1.2).**
* **For some users, additional troubleshooting steps were required, such as closing and reopening the app or manually removing conflicting files.**

**Problems Identified:**

* **PiecesOS startup issues:** users reported delays in the boot-up process or complete failure to start.
* **Conflicting software:** OneDrive was causing issues for some users.
* **Outdated software:** using an older version of PiecesOS could lead to problems.
* **App installer issues:** the app installer may have caused problems on some systems.
* **Software glitches:** bugs in the desktop app could contribute to startup issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Updating to the latest version (11.1.2):** This resolved the issue for most users.
* **Restarting the app:** This sometimes helped to resolve the issue.
* **Removing conflicting files:** Removing the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive resolved the issue for some users.
* **Troubleshooting steps provided by the Pieces team:** These included checking system requirements, reinstalling the app, and providing logs for further analysis.
* **Releasing a patch for the desktop app (3.3.8):** This patch aimed to prevent the hanging issue in the future.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **The issue appears to be resolved for most users after updating to the latest version (11.1.2).**
* **The Pieces team continues to monitor the situation and provide support to users experiencing issues.**
* **A patch for the desktop app (3.3.8) has been released to address the hanging issue.**

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary focuses on the GitHub issue conversation and may not reflect all discussions or solutions related to this issue.
* Users with ongoing issues are encouraged to contact the Pieces team for further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users (@DevWizard24, @GetReal444) reported being unable to launch Pieces after updating to version 11.1.1.
* The issue was caused by stricter hardware requirements in the new version.
* Pieces support team requested logs for troubleshooting and identified the problem.
* A fix was released in version 11.1.2.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces 11.1.1 had stricter hardware requirements than initially communicated, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team requested user logs for diagnosis.
* A patch (version 11.1.2) was released to resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with version 11.1.2. Users are advised to update.
* Issue closed, can be reopened if problems persist after updating.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: PiecesOS version 11.1.1 introduced a dependency on the AVX2 instruction set for its vector library, causing launch crashes on unsupported CPUs. This affected users on macOS and Windows. The issue was acknowledged by the Pieces team and a fix was released in version 11.1.2, removing the AVX2 requirement.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Vector Library Issue 
 
### Key Points:
 
* User "gonzososa" reported an issue with PiecesOS on MacOS (M1 chip). 
* The problem was related to the vector library requiring AVX2 support, which was not available on their CPU.
* Developer "tsavo-at-pieces" acknowledged the problem and informed users that a fix would be released.
 
### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:
 
* The developer team released an update (version 11.1.2) with a solution for the AVX2 issue. 
 
### Current Status/Outcome:
 
* The issue has been resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* User "gonzososa" confirmed that the update fixed the problem for them.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of the GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* GetReal444 is experiencing an issue booting up Pieces OS.
* The error message mentions the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension not being loaded due to AVX2 not being supported on the user's processor.
* GetReal444 provided logs and screenshots of their machine's specs for troubleshooting.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to launch Pieces OS.
* The CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension requires AVX2 instruction set which is not available on the user's processor.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces Support team is actively working on a solution and expects to have a patch released within 24-48 hours.
* A temporary workaround is to share the tech specs of the user's machine.
* User is requested to update to the latest version (11.1.2) of Pieces OS.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Bug fix released in version 11.1.2 of Pieces OS.
* GetReal444 confirmed the issue is resolved after updating to the latest version.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue is impacting several users.
* Pieces Support team is providing proactive updates and actively working on a resolution.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version of Pieces OS.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS boot up failure
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS failing to boot up on Ubuntu, Windows, and macOS. The errors often mention "DatabaseException" and problems loading the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension.  A common solution is to update to the latest Pieces OS version (11.1.2).

## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Booting Issue

* User @Rohit0072 reported an issue with the Pieces app not booting up.
* The bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* @mark-at-pieces apologized for the inconvenience and offered support.
* @tsavo-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and linked it to other reports.
* @tsavo-at-pieces informed about a potential fix with a release expected by EOD the next day.
* @mark-at-pieces suggested updating to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 for resolution.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was not booting up for @Rohit0072.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Updating to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 was proposed.
* A potential fix was mentioned with a release expected by EOD the next day.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed by @mark-at-pieces.
* It's unclear if the user confirmed resolution after updating. 
* If the issue persists, the user can reopen the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Sign-in Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces cloud services and local LLMs, as well as signing into the Pieces app.  Suggested solutions include checking network configurations, firewall settings, and clearing browser cache.  Contact Pieces support for persistent issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Rohanrathi99 reported difficulty in making requests to Pieces cloud services and using local models.

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 shared screenshots showing the error messages.
* Mark-at-pieces suspected firewall or network configuration issues blocking outgoing requests.
* Rohanrathi99 uploaded the requested log files to Google Drive.

**Solutions:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested access to the log files for further investigation.
* Rohanrathi99 granted access to the files.

**Current Status:**

* Mark-at-pieces has access to the log files and will likely analyze them to diagnose the problem and propose a solution.

**Outcome:**

* Pending resolution.

**Additional Notes:**

* Rohanrathi99 was offered helpful resources while awaiting a response.
* Mark-at-pieces provided a link to their calendar for real-time debugging if preferred.

I hope this summary is concise and informative. Please let me know if you have any further questions.

related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue Title:** Unable to download local LLMs

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @AmanSingh766 is experiencing an exception when trying to download local LLMs.
* The error message is "Connection closed before full header was received."
* User is unable to confirm if the error occurs every time or only during specific attempts.

**Problems Identified:**

* Issue appears to be related to communication with the local LLM server.
* Download process is interrupted before completion.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support team requested support logs from the user to diagnose the issue.
* Suggested that the issue might be resolved in Pieces OS version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the issue is resolved. User did not provide feedback after the last response from Pieces support. 
* **Action Required:** User needs to confirm whether the issue persists or has been fixed.

Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Updated

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i install Pieces for vs code and its not connecting to my google account and github account , i install extension in vs code when i try to connect their github it this error is showing "Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened. If the issue persists, please contact support. in Windows"
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User Usama-integriti is experiencing an issue signing in to the Pieces app.

**Problems identified:**

* Unable to sign in.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Clear browser cache.
* User to schedule time with support representative (mark-at-pieces) for further assistance.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is unclear if user has implemented the proposed solutions. User needs to schedule time with support for further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The bot suggests checking related issues and helpful resources.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch issues:** The majority of reported issues revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after update 11.1.1. Focus engineering efforts on resolving these launch problems and ensuring smooth startup across platforms.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The launch issues stemming from stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 highlight the need for clearer communication about system requirements before and during updates.

**Investigate and address connectivity problems:**  Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces cloud services and local LLMs. Investigate potential root causes, such as firewall conflicts or network configuration issues, and provide clear troubleshooting steps.

**Enhance sign-in process and error handling:**  The reported sign-in issues indicate potential areas for improvement in the authentication process. Implement robust error handling to provide users with more informative messages and guidance when sign-in problems occur.

**Proactively monitor for emerging issues:** Continuously monitor support tickets and community forums for patterns or spikes in specific issues. This will enable quicker identification and response to emerging problems, minimizing user impact.

**Develop comprehensive troubleshooting resources:** Create detailed troubleshooting guides and FAQs addressing common issues like launch failures, connectivity problems, and sign-in errors.  Make these resources easily accessible within the application and on the Pieces website.

**Consider a more robust testing process:** The issues arising from update 11.1.1 suggest potential improvements in the testing process. Implement rigorous testing across various hardware and software configurations to identify and address potential problems before release.
